docs.title: codeBrowse by Technology
docs.text:
PythonTelegram APIArchitectureMore Coming

Enterprise Telegram Bot - Advanced Python architecture with PostgreSQL, Stripe integration, and scalable design patterns.

Bot Development - Comprehensive bot platform with webhooks, conversation management, and monetization features.

System Design - Enterprise-grade architecture blueprints with detailed implementation plans and best practices.

Additional projects and technical documentation will be added here as they're published.

docs.title: flagProject Vision & Core Purpose
docs.text: Goal: To build an enterprise-grade Telegram bot that transforms a Telegram channel into a comprehensive business and communication platform.

docs.title: Key Functions:
docs.text:
• 💰 Monetization Engine: Sophisticated system for selling services via Stripe
  • Smart credit system
  • Time-based access
  • Pay-to-unlock premium content
  • Auto-recharge subscriptions
  • 👥 Admin Conversation Management: Topic-based system in private admin group
  • 📊 Business Intelligence: Advanced analytics on revenue and user engagement

docs.title: Core Principles:
docs.text:
• ✅ Scalable - Handle thousands of concurrent users
  • ✅ Reliable - 99.9% uptime with proper error handling
  • ✅ Modular - Clean, maintainable codebase
  • ✅ Secure - Webhook-based, encrypted communications

docs.title: settingsTech Stack & Key Libraries
docs.text: Component Technology Version Language Python 3.11+ Framework Flask + Gunicorn Latest Telegram python-telegram-bot[ext] 21.x+ Database PostgreSQL 15+ DB Driver psycopg2-binary Latest Payments Stripe API Latest Environment python-dotenv Latest Deployment Docker + Railway -

docs.title: account_treeProject Architecture
docs.text:
Text Only
telegram_bot/
├── 📁 src/                    # Core application logic
│   ├── __init__.py
│   ├── bot.py                 # Main bot handlers and logic
│   ├── database.py            # Database connection and queries
│   ├── config.py              # Environment variable management
│   ├── error_handler.py       # Global error handling
│   ├── cache.py               # Caching layer
│   ├── webhook_server.py      # Flask/Gunicorn server
│   └── stripe_utils.py        # Stripe API functions
├── 📁 scripts/                # One-off scripts
│   └── setup_db.py
├── 📁 deployment/             # Deployment files
│   └── Dockerfile
├── 📁 docs/                   # Documentation
│   ├── PROJECT_BLUEPRINT.md
│   └── schema.sql
├── .env                       # Environment variables
├── .gitignore
└── requirements.txt

docs.title: Phase 1: Initial Setup ⚡
docs.text:
1. Initialize Git repository
  2. Create .gitignore with Python and .env entries
  3. Create full folder structure
  4. Set up requirements.txt with all dependencies

docs.title: Phase 2: Database & Configuration 🗄️
docs.text:
1. Create docs/schema.sql - Complete database schema
  2. Create src/config.py - Environment variable loading
  3. Create src/database.py - Connection pool implementation
  4. Create scripts/setup_db.py - Database initialization

docs.title: Phase 3: Core Bot Logic 🧠
docs.text:
1. User Commands Implementation:
  2. /start - Onboarding with product showcase
  3. /balance - Visual credit/time display
  4. /billing - Stripe customer portal

  5. Quick-buy commands (/buy10, /buy50)

  6. Admin Conversation Bridge:

  7. Topic-based message routing
  8. User-to-admin forwarding
  9. Admin-to-user responses
  10. Real-time status updates

docs.title: Phase 4: Webhook Server & Payments 💳
docs.text:
1. Flask Application Setup:
  2. /telegram-webhook endpoint
  3. /stripe-webhook endpoint (with signature verification)

  4. /health monitoring endpoint

  5. Stripe Integration:

  6. Checkout session creation
  7. Payment confirmation handling
  8. Subscription management
  9. Billing portal access

docs.title: Phase 5: Production Deployment 🌐
docs.text:
1. Docker Configuration:
  2. Multi-stage build process
  3. Production-ready Gunicorn setup

  4. Health checks and monitoring

  5. Railway Deployment:

  6. Environment variable configuration
  7. Database connection setup
  8. SSL/TLS certificate management

docs.title: 📋 Database Schema Overview
docs.text:
SQL
-- Users table with comprehensive tracking
CREATE TABLE users (
    id BIGINT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(255),
    first_name VARCHAR(255),
    credits INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    unlimited_until TIMESTAMP,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
    last_active TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
    total_spent DECIMAL(10,2) DEFAULT 0,
    message_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0
);

-- Conversation topics for admin management
CREATE TABLE conversation_topics (
    user_id BIGINT REFERENCES users(id),
    topic_id INTEGER,
    group_id BIGINT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, group_id)
);

-- Transaction tracking for analytics
CREATE TABLE transactions (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id BIGINT REFERENCES users(id),
    stripe_session_id VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE,
    amount DECIMAL(10,2),
    credits_granted INTEGER,
    status VARCHAR(50),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

docs.title: Smart Credit System
docs.text:
• Flexible Pricing: Multiple credit packages (10, 50, 100, 500 credits)
  • Auto-Recharge: Set up recurring payments for power users
  • Bonus Credits: Loyalty rewards and promotional campaigns
  • Usage Analytics: Detailed spending and usage patterns

docs.title: Admin Dashboard
docs.text:
• Real-time Monitoring: Live user activity and system health
  • Revenue Analytics: Daily, weekly, monthly earning reports
  • User Management: Quick actions for credits, bans, and support
  • Conversation Insights: Message volume and response times

docs.title: Enterprise Security
docs.text:
• Webhook Verification: Stripe signature validation
  • Rate Limiting: Protection against spam and abuse
  • Error Handling: Graceful degradation and recovery
  • Audit Logging: Complete transaction and interaction history

docs.title: trending_upSuccess Metrics
docs.text: Metric Target Description Uptime 99.9% System availability Response Time <2s Message processing speed Revenue $10k/month Monthly recurring revenue User Retention 80% 30-day active users Conversion Rate 15% Free to paid conversion
